text: Jean-Paul Sermain is a French academic teaching at the University of Paris III: Sorbonne Nouvelle. A specialist of the eighteenth century, his research concerns the 18th-century French literature, the poetics of the novel and fairy tales. He also leads studies on works by Marivaux, Prévost and Diderot. == Bibliography == *1999: Le Singe de don Quichotte : Marivaux, Cervantes et le roman postcritique, Oxford : Voltaire Foundation *2002: Métafictions 1670-1730.
